definition: to look up at/to look up to sb hopefully
surname Yang
to face upward/to look up/to admire/to rely on
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
15th day of month (lunar calendar)/old variant of 望[wang4]

sentences.english: Looking up at the open sky, he suddenly cheered up.
sentences.chinese: 仰望碧天，他的心情豁然开朗。

sentences.english: We looked to the east. The clouds were reddish and then turned bright red.
sentences.chinese: 我们仰望东方，只见云彩由微红变到鲜红。

sentences.english: Ever looked up at the night sky and wondered: What is up there?
sentences.chinese: 你可曾仰望夜空，思索着上面到底有什么？

sentences.english: Looking at the sky, I am just like a lonely little house slightly stand on the horizon.
sentences.chinese: 仰望天空，我只是地平线上一座孤独平微的小屋。

sentences.english: I looked upon the Nile and raised the pyramids above it.
sentences.chinese: 我仰望尼罗河，在那上面建造金字塔。

sentences.english: Thou to whom I dare not lift mine eyes, wilt Thou yet pardon me?
sentences.chinese: 啊，我不敢抬眼仰望的天神啊，你还肯再饶恕我吧。

sentences.english: How do you keep your eyes on Jesus when they're full of tears?
sentences.chinese: 当双目充满泪水时，你如何能定晴仰望耶稣？

sentences.english: They looked up at the night sky as they snuggled .
sentences.chinese: 他们依偎在一起，仰望着夜空。

sentences.english: People always want to look at something, toward high and shore up the life and soul.
sentences.chinese: 人总要仰望点什么，向着高远，支撑起生命和灵魂。

sentences.english: We are all in the gutter , but some of us are looking at the stars.
sentences.chinese: 我们都在沟中，但其中一些人在仰望星星。

sentences.english: I like to walk in the park and look at the stars at night.
sentences.chinese: 晚上我喜欢在公园里散步，仰望着天上的群星。

sentences.english: I look upto the sky, when the milky accompany me the ball.
sentences.chinese: 抬头仰望着漫天星河，那时候陪伴我的那颗。

sentences.english: Look'd up in perfect silence at the stars.
sentences.chinese: 在纯然的寂静中仰望星辰。

sentences.english: He raised his mournful eyes towards the deep blue sky.
sentences.chinese: 他满眼哀伤，仰望着深兰色的天空。

sentences.english: Aspirations are like lofty mountains that we look up to.
sentences.chinese: 渴望就像是我们抬头仰望时那巍峨的山脉。

sentences.english: I haven't seen the jebel , haven't get into the habit of look up.
sentences.chinese: 我没有见过大山，没有养成仰望的习惯。

definition: to tilt one's head back to see (sth)/to look up at
to look into the distance
to overlook/to look down at
to survey the scene from an elevated position
to gaze at/to stare fixedly at
to overlook/to look down from a height
to gaze into the distance
to gaze afar/to look into the distance
to stand for a long time
summit
to raise one's head and look into the distance/fig. to forward to/to long for
tall and erect, reaching through the clouds (idiom); used to describe tall mountain or skyscraper
sky
to gaze at/to fix one's eyes on
in sight but unattainable (idiom)/inaccessible
pinyin: ke3 wang4 er2 bu4 ke3 ji2

definition: lofty/towering/majestic
